quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Idiot and Plato
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, user. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what century did Greek philosopher Plato live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5th-4th century BC

questions.question: Name the Austrian journalist, writer, satirist, essayist, aphorist, playwright and poet who said, “Education is a crutch with which the foolish attack the wise to prove that they are not idiots.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karl Kraus

questions.question: Which one of the Beatles said this: “I resent performing for frisking idiots who dont know anything.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Which famous comedian of silent films said: “Man as an individual is a genius. But men in the mass form the headless monster, a great, brutish idiot that goes where prodded.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Chaplin

questions.question: According to Plato, the structure of society corresponds to the structure of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Human soul

questions.question: Which famous composer of the 17th  18th century said “If I decide to be an idiot, then Ill be an idiot on my own accord.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johann Sebastian Bach

questions.question: “Cluelessness - There are no stupid questions, but there are a LOT of inquisitive idiots.” is a quote by this American sociologist and author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry Kersten

questions.question: “The word user is the word used by the computer professional when they mean idiot.” is a quote from this winner of a Pulitzer Prize for Commentary.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Barry

questions.question: “Half the world is composed of idiots, the other half of people clever enough to take indecent advantage of them” was uttered by this writer and Broadway critic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Kerr

questions.question: Which American lyrical poet, playwright and feminist wrote “April comes like an idiot, babbling and stewing flowers.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edna St. Vincent Millay

questions.question: Plato believed that reality could not be perceived by which of the following type of people?

options.text: Those who have immense imagination, people of arts
Those who live with thoughts of their past of future
Those who put their own happiness above everything and everyone else

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Those who use their senses

questions.question: In Plato’s opinion, human society should be governed by people who possess these main virtues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wisdom and reason

questions.question: What famous playwright wrote: “Life is a tale told by an idiot -- full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Shakespeare

questions.question: This poet, painter and printmaker said, “What is grand is necessarily obscure to weak men. That which can be made explicit to the idiot is not worth my care.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Blake

questions.question: Platos influence has been especially strong in which of the following subjects?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mathematics

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Aristotle Onassis and Plato
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, affair. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What member of Aristole Onasis family died in a plane crush?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his son

questions.question: In what present day country was Aristotle Onassis born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkey

questions.question: Plato was the middle name of Aristotle Onassis, the prominent shipping magnate of the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Athina Onassis Roussel is the granddaughter of Aristotle Onassis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What family relationship occupied much of the thoughts of Greek philosopher Plato?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Father-son relationship

questions.question: In 1954, Aristotle Onassis was investigated by the FBI for fraud against the U.S. government.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: David Beckhams parents were ardent fans of this football team, and they passed the passion to their son.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manchester United

questions.question: Which of these women is the mother of Aristotle Onassis’ two children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athina Livanos

questions.question: Where did Aristotle Onassis go after leaving his home country in 1923.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buenos Aires, Argentina

questions.question: What was the name of the famous ancient school founded by Plato in Athens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Academy

questions.question: In which country was David Beckham born on May 2, 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: Aristotle Onassis had a notorious affair with this opera diva.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria Callas

questions.question: At the age of 16, Aristotle Onassis spoke four languages.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Aristotle Onassis father had a fleet of how many ships?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10

questions.question: What was David Beckhams dream job back when he was a child?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Football player

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Casanova and David Beckham
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Apart from women, this remained Casanovas uncontrollable passion throughout his whole life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gambling

questions.question: What TV host made David Beckham take off his Shirt on their TV show in April 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellen DeGeneres

questions.question: What is the name of the fragrance for men released by David Beckham in 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Beckham Instinct

questions.question: What is the title of the popular partly autobiographical book written by Casanova?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Story of My Life

questions.question: Casanova had a brief career in this institution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church

questions.question: What is the name of David Beckhams first-born son?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooklyn

questions.question: Who became the godfather of David and Victoria Beckhams sons Brooklyn and Romeo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elton John

questions.question: What was the first football club for which David Beckham played professionally?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tottenham Hotspur

questions.question: Why did David Beckham have numerous tattoos done all over his body?

options.text: He wanted to feel more colorful.
His father had many tattoos, he followed his example.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was addicted to it.

questions.question: What is the first name of Casanova, the most popular lover ever born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giacomo

questions.question: What was the shortest way to a womans heart according to Casanova?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gratitude

questions.question: Casanova was good at playing this musical instrument and he even became a professional musician for some time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Violin

questions.question: What is the title of the 2002 movie that involved David Beckhams name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bend It Like Beckham

questions.question: Casanova graduated from the University of Padua, Italy, with a degree in this academic field.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Law

questions.question: How did Casanova once save the life of a Venetian nobleman of the Bragadin family?

options.text: By putting leeches all over his body
By applying a mercury-based ointment all over his body

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By having him bled

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Series and Character
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which famous alcoholic film actor is best known for his romantic swashbuckler roles such as his role in The Adventures of Robin Hood?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Errol Flynn

questions.question: In the TV series The Brady Bunch, this widowed architect married Carol Martin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Brady

questions.question: What was the name of Fred Astaires famous dancing partner in the films Roberta, The Gay Divorcee and Shall we Dance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ginger Rogers

questions.question: Name the famous alcoholic who was Republican Senator from Wisconsin between 1947 and 1957 and made freewheeling accusations of communist sympathies against people in the U.S. government.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph McCarthy

questions.question: What was the name of the animated alcoholic which was known for his belches on The Simpsons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barney Gumble

questions.question: What is the name of the fictional alcoholic from The Andy Griffith Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Otis Campbell

questions.question: This famous alcoholic actor starred in The Bank Dick. He was also quoted saying I never drink anything stronger than gin before breakfast.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W.C. Fields

questions.question: This character, portrayed by Ellen Corby, was married to Zeb Walton in the TV series, The Waltons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Esther

questions.question: Which American jazz singer, a famous alcoholic, was also known as Lady Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billie Holiday

questions.question: Which alcoholic singer and movie actor was partnered with Jerry Lewis for many years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dean Martin

questions.question: This prolific writer and actress co-starred with her husband, Roy Rogers, in the popular television series, The Roy Rogers Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dale Evans

questions.question: This character from the sitcom Green Acres, portrayed by Eva Gabor, was the wife of Oliver Wendell Douglas, a successful New York City attorney.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lisa Douglas

questions.question: Which politician, who suffered from alcoholism, was the 14th President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Pierce

questions.question: This famous American poet and short story writer, alleged to have died as a result of alcoholism, wrote the poem The Raven.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allan Poe

questions.question: These are believed to have been the very last words of Casanova before his death.

options.text: The mind succumbs to an apathy against which nothing avails.
I have lived as a philosopher and I die as a Christian.
I am writing My Life to laugh at myself, and I am succeeding.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I have lived as a philosopher and I die as a Christian.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Elizabeth and Ontario
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, mary. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This famous Canadian actor, who starred in over 100 movies and TV shows, is best known for playing either cowboys or ordinary people in extraordinary circumstances.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Glenn Ford

questions.question: Which celebrity was born Eileen Regina Edwards, in Windsor, Ontario?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shania Twain

questions.question: Which famous journalist was born in Toronto Ontario on July 29, 1938?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Jennings

questions.question: Elizabeth Is privateers, known as Sea Dogs, were a colorful chapter in her reign. One of these claimed international celebrity by circumnavigating the globe. Name him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Drake

questions.question: Bloody Mary was the pejorative nickname given to Mary Stuart, Queen of Scots.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which Canadian is the inventor of basketball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Naismith

questions.question: This Canadian author is known for his novel which was adapted into a Kevin Costner movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W.P. Kinsella

questions.question: Which famous person was born on October 25, 1912  in Hamilton, Ontario?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Kent Cooke

questions.question: Which of Henry VIIIs chancellors had an international reputation as a great Renaissance Humanist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Thomas More

questions.question: He was born in Wilmot Nova Scotia in 1844, and was the first man to sail around the world alone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josua Slocum

questions.question: While Elizabeth I never married, she retained a lifelong attraction to her Master of Horse, Robert Dudley, who was honored with this title.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl of Leicester

questions.question: Which of he following famous English dramatists was NOT a part of the Elizabethan era?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Sheridan

questions.question: It is one of those dynastic ironies that the great royal enemy of Elizabeth I of England, Philip II of Spain, was also related to her in what way?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was her brother-in-law.

questions.question: Mark Twains well loved story, The Prince and the Pauper involves the adventures of a teenage pauper and this English Prince who exchange their roles and identity.

options.text: Edward VI, son and heir of Henry VIII
James Stuart, the future James I who was the son of Mary Queen of Scots
Henry Fitzroi, the illegitimate son of Henry VIII
Arthur, the eldest son of Henry VII

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward VI, son and heir of Henry VIII

questions.question: The Tudor dynasty was founded by a Welsh adventurer, Owen Tudor, who gained prominence by marrying the widow of Henry V, Margaret Beaufort.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
